Chapter on Hell, Part 8
Also, the fruits of stealing:
Because of evil karma, one sees one's own possessions being robbed by others in that hell, and immediately runs after them.
Having run like this, the Yama demons take sharp iron swords and cut and hack, severing all the veins. Having severed them, they grow back again.

Moreover, other hell beings come running quickly, and the Yama demons also seize them, with swords, spears, clubs, and halberds all ablaze, stabbing, slashing, and beating them. This is the retribution for the evil karma of stealing.

In this way, for countless hundreds of thousands of years, until the fruits of unwholesome karma of stealing are destroyed, become lifeless, rot, and disappear, will that person be able to escape from there.
Also, one who engages in sexual misconduct:

He saw his former wife being swept away by the river of ashes, crying out in extreme distress, sometimes emerging and sometimes sinking due to the evil waves, calling out to the hell denizens, saying:
I am now in this evil place of the river of ashes, without a guide or savior. You can now come and save me from this difficulty!

When the hell denizen heard her crying, with a deluded mind due to evil karma, he entered the river of ashes. As soon as he entered, his entire body was dissolved by the ashes, leaving not even a mustard seed's worth remaining, only his remaining bones. Later, flesh grew again.
When the flesh had grown, he saw his former wife further ahead in the river of ashes, crying out again, saying:
Save me, save me!
The man immediately went forward, and the woman ran to him. Having arrived, he wanted to embrace the woman.

The women embrace them, but the women's bodies are all burning iron, blazing with flames, with sharp iron claws. Having embraced them, they immediately tear them apart, their bodies destroyed to the point where not even a mustard seed's worth of intact flesh remains, only bones.
In this way, the sinful person's entire body is covered in blood, with only sinew nets remaining.

The hell denizens, their minds covered by lust, see the women and run towards them, into the river of ashes. For countless hundreds of thousands of years, they are thus swept away by the evil current, thus burned by the evil flames, until their evil karma is exhausted, rotten, and its energy dissipated. At all times, suffering is unceasing. When their karma there is exhausted, they are then able to escape.
Thus reborn again, their bodies burned by hunger and thirst, they run about everywhere. They see again a river, a pond, clear water, hoping for cold water, and quickly run towards it.

Having arrived there, the river and pond are filled with molten white lead, and it is full of extremely poisonous snakes. The hell beings, extremely thirsty, then drink this mixture of poisonous snakes and molten white lead.

The extremely fine, extremely poisonous snakes created by their evil karma enter the mouths of the sinners. Having entered their bellies, they immediately grow large. The bellies of the hell beings also expand. In this way, the evil snakes within their bodies bite everything, first biting the small intestines and devouring them. This is the consequence of the sin of the precept-breaker drinking alcohol.

In this way, for innumerable hundreds of thousands of years, deceived by their evil karma, bitten by the snakes, and burned by the white lead, they are burned and bitten in this way. Having died, they are revived. The precept-breaker drinking alcohol is a consequence of breaking the precepts.

Moreover, due to the evil fruits of the karma of lying, they are bitten by snakes on the tongue. In this way, for innumerable hundreds of thousands of years, they experience great suffering, until their evil karma is exhausted, rotten, and its energy is depleted. At all times, suffering is unceasing. When the karma there is exhausted, they are then able to escape.
Having escaped from there, they run about everywhere and again see the fruits of unwholesome thoughts.
The hell beings, created by karma, say this:
'Why are you unjustly burned and have no place to stay here?
I will show you a place and let you find happiness.'
The Yama demons, having said this, take the hell beings and place them in another place within the hells. That place is different, with many different kinds of suffering.
The Yama hell wardens will again inflict various sufferings on the hell beings, namely, burning them with great fires in all directions, burning them everywhere on steep cliffs.
They will again enter the place of the great body, the fearful evil roar, constantly burning and boiling. Thus they will suffer. The body is huge and extremely soft, ten yojanas in size.

They will again enter the place called Fire Topknot, where they will be born and experience great suffering. The fire in that place of Fire Topknot is extremely hot, greater than all other fires. This fire is supreme and has no equal.
In that place of Fire Topknot, fire sand is constantly rained down to burn and boil it. That sand flows thickly like rain in the summer.
There is another place called Inner Boiling Heat, where dark fire constantly burns and boils, causing the bodies of the sinners to swell like leather bags.
There is another place called Chata Chati, where all the sinners suffer greatly from rubbing and cutting each other's bodies.

There is another place called Universal Suffering from All Living Conditions, where they are cooked and suffer greatly. In such a place, there are many fearful evil dogs, lions, crows, vultures, pigs, and snakes, all causing suffering.

There is also an evil river called Vitarani, where they are burned and floated away, cooked and rotten. The hot ashes of the river, red copper, white lead, and burning boiling water, hundreds and thousands of evil floats and burns, such is the cooking.
There is another place called Uninterrupted Darkness, where sinners enter and are burned and cooked in the darkness, suffering various kinds of pain.

There is another place called the place of painful garlands, where the offenders enter and are burned and cooked, suffering from the pain of a hot flaming iron wheel turning on their heads, and being sawed and split all over their bodies.ğŸ”½If they escape from there, they enter another place called the rain of garlands and tassels, where they are burned again and cooked again, their whole bodies ablaze. Having been burned like this, the Yama demons stab them hundreds and thousands of times with flaming knives.

If they escape from there, they enter again the place of crows and lumps of garlands, where they are burned and cooked. There, their skeletal bodies are like snow. Fire arises from their own bodies. Those hell beings each grasp sharp knives and cut and slice each other like this for countless hundreds of thousands of years.

If they escape from there, they enter again the place of sorrowful wailing, where in that evil place they are constantly burned and constantly cooked. Having been cooked like this, they let out a great wail. Such wailing is not found in any of the other hells.

If they manage to escape, they will enter another place called Great Compassion. Those people, due to their wrong views, praise unwholesome dharmas as the Dharma. Due to their evil karma, those with wrong views will see their beloved ones, either their father, son, brother, or friend, in the place of Great Compassion, being burned and boiled, their bodies twisted in pain, crying out:
'I am now alone and helpless. Come and save me!'
Those fathers, sons, brothers, and friends, in extreme grief and sorrow, will raise their arms and cry out.
When the hell beings see this, the fire of sorrow and grief will arise, burning the fuel of love. The heat of the fire of sorrow and grief will make the fire of hell seem like ice and snow.
Burned by these two great fires, they will suffer greatly and cry out.
The Yama demons will then speak a verse, reprimanding them, saying:
The fire of love is hotter than fire, other fires are like ice,
The fire of hell here, the fire of craving in the three realms,
Such is the fire of hell, but it is insignificant and not worth mentioning,
If the fire born from the cause of craving, with abundant flames and poisonous heat.
The evil-doers in hell, only escape when their karma is exhausted,
The fire of craving burns the three realms, and there is no hope of escape.
Craving can bind people, in beginningless birth and death,
The fire of craving is hell, not the fire born from hell.
Although the fire of hell is hot, it can only burn the body,
The fire of craving burns sentient beings, burning both body and mind.
The fire born from the cause of craving, the supreme among fires,
The fire of hell is not universal, the fire of craving is everywhere.
Acting in the three causes and three places, the three kinds of karma manifest,
Born in the three periods of time, all are the fire of the mind of craving.
The fire of desire burns in the heavens, the fire of anger burns in the animal realm,
The fire of delusion burns in the hells, the fire of craving burns everywhere.
Thus, the fire of the mind of craving burns, and the three realms are ablaze,
Seeing what unpleasant phenomena?
Now, my mind regrets like this.'
The Yama demons in that great hell of compassion scold the hell beings like this.

Having scolded them, they again inflict various sufferings on them.ğŸ”½The sinners there escape, but are again boiled in the hell of no compassion and darkness. The fire there burns the hell beings, their color like the coral tree.

If the sinners escape from there, they are again boiled in the hell of turning on wood. The hell beings there are boiled in sixteen places. The evil karma of those who are covered by wrong views and violate a bhiká¹£uá¹‡Ä« is like this.
That person there is burned for countless years, for a very long time, until his evil karma is exhausted, rotten, and its energy dissipated. At all times he is given suffering without pause;
only when his evil karma is exhausted will he escape that hell.

Although escaping that place, he will be reborn among hungry ghosts and animals, for countless thousands of lifetimes hungry and thirsty, burning and boiling, devouring each other, eating hundreds of thousands of bodies.

In this way, due to evil wrong views, he again violates the precepts of a bhikshunÄ«. It is difficult for such a person to obtain a human body, like a turtle encountering a hole in a floating piece of wood.
If reborn among humans in a place of similar karma, for five hundred lifetimes he will be a eunuch, due to the remaining karmic consequences of the unwholesome evil karma of violating a bhikshunÄ«.
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£u, knowing the consequences of karma, contemplated the realm of the great burning hell.
He saw, heard and knew:

If a person kills, steals, engages in sexual misconduct, drinks alcohol, lies, or has wrong views, the results of their actions are as previously explained. Moreover, if a person violates the pure precepts of an upÄsaka, when their body perishes and their life ends, they will fall into a bad place, into that hell, and be born in the place of universal burning heat, experiencing great suffering.
The so-called suffering is as follows:
In that hell, everything without exception, up to and including space, is burning, with no place not burning, not even the size of a needle point.

That person stretches out their hand in the fire, crying out with the most urgent and intense voice, burned by the powerful, firm, and intense flames, with no ash to be found. Moreover, they are reborn again, constantly burning like this for countless hundreds of thousands of years without cease.

If they escape from there, hoping for rescue and refuge, they run to another place. As they run thus, the Yama demons seize them again, and a burning iron rope wraps around their feet and goes up to their heads, gradually tightening, with blood flowing up and gathering in their heads. Then they again nail their heads with burning iron hooks, coming out from under their chins.
They again grab iron hooks and twist and pull them violently, and the blood of the sinners flows out like molten copper, hot and blazing, pouring over their bodies.
Thus for innumerable hundreds of thousands of years, blood pours over their bodies and burns them. They die and come back to life, die and come back to life again.
By the power of evil karma, they are always burned and cooked like this, until their evil karma is destroyed, rotten, and its energy exhausted. At all times, they are given suffering without cease;
If their evil karma is exhausted, they will then escape that hell realm and be born among hungry ghosts and animals for immeasurable hundreds of thousands of years.
If born as a hungry ghost, they will suffer from hunger and thirst;
if among animals, they will suffer from devouring each other, and for immeasurable hundreds of thousands of lifetimes, they will be killed and eaten by others.
After that evil-doing person has experienced that suffering, it is difficult for them to obtain a human body, like a turtle encountering a hole.

If born among humans in a place of similar karma, they will be poor and sickly, always tormented by others, their minds agitated and unceasing, and they will not live long, becoming eunuchs for four hundred lifetimes.
This is the remaining karmic retribution of that evil karma.
Furthermore, that bhiká¹£u, knowing the fruits of karma, contemplated the realm of the great burning hell.
He saw, heard, and knew:

If a person kills, steals, engages in sexual misconduct, drinks alcohol, lies, or has wrong views, the results of their actions are as previously explained. Moreover, if a person violates the precepts of a pure-practicing novice monk, their body will perish and their life will end, falling into a place of evil, being born in the terrifying place of great body and evil roar in that hell, experiencing great suffering.

The so-called suffering is as previously explained, the suffering experienced in the hells such as Saá¹ƒjÄ«va, all that suffering is fully experienced in the terrifying place of great body and evil roar.
There is also a greater [suffering]:

The body of that criminal is one yojana in size, extremely tender like a lump of fresh butter. The henchmen of Yama seize their body and with fine tweezers pull out all their hair, pulling it out together with the flesh, from head to toe, without leaving even a mustard seed's worth of unpulled hair.

The person there experiences the most extreme suffering of being crushed, crying out loudly. The other hell beings hear this and their hearts break, crack open, and scatter. Deceived by the enemy of the mind, they create evil karma and are deceived by their own karma, thus making this sound.
The hell beings there experience such suffering. The Yama demons, in order to reproach them, speak a verse, saying:
The mind of desire produces sweet words, hearing sweet words arouses desire,
The words of desire are extremely evil, now experiencing such fruits.ğŸ”½The words of desire are the sharpest blade, that blade cuts one's own body,
It is better to cut off one's own tongue, than to speak words of sexual desire.
Beings deceived by desire, with an angry mind burning fiercely,
Because upheld by the mind of delusion, they speak sweet words of sexual desire.
The pleasure of sexual desire is little, but the evil karma created is much,
The deluded person, upheld by the mind of desire, goes from suffering to suffering.
The pleasures of a single moment, not pleasurable and impermanent,
Transmigrating and experiencing extreme suffering, thus one should abandon desires.
Those covered by desire dwell in the house of hell,
If one is not subject to desire, then one does not fear hell.
If a person creates evil karma, they will definitely experience suffering,
Why does this pitiful and contemptible person now cry out in grief?
The person in hell who acts badly will be liberated when their karma is exhausted,
There is no reason for one with many cries to be liberated.
If a person desires freedom, they create unloved and evil karma,
The foolish person now experiences suffering, what benefit is there in crying out?
If one sees future results, and in the present delights in goodness,
That person will not cry out, like you do now, day after day.
The Yama demons reprimand the person who has acted with evil karma in this way:

Having scolded them, they will again inflict various immeasurable sufferings on them, until their evil karma is exhausted, rotten, and its energy is depleted, and they will not cease their torment at any time;
only when their evil karma is exhausted will they escape that hell.
Having escaped, they will be born among hungry ghosts and animals for immeasurable thousands of lifetimes.
Having escaped from there, it is difficult for them to obtain a human body, like a turtle encountering a hole.

If they are born among humans in a place of similar karma, they will have a short life, be poor, have a disordered and incorrect mind, and no one will believe their words. For four thousand lifetimes, they will be impotent.
This is the remaining karmic retribution of their evil karma.
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us know the fruits of karma and contemplate the place of the great burning and intense hot hells.
They see, hear, and know:
There is another place called the place of flaming hair, which is the third separate place in that hell.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
They see:

If someone kills, steals, engages in sexual misconduct, drinks alcohol, lies, or holds wrong views, enjoying and frequently engaging in these actions, the karma and its results are as explained above. If someone further engages in sexual misconduct with a woman who is under the protection of her parents, husband, or even her own hairdo,
that person, due to the causes and conditions of this evil karma, will, when body and life end, fall into a bad place, be born in the hell of Fire Topknot, and experience immense suffering.
The suffering referred to is as explained above, the suffering experienced in the hells such as Saá¹ƒjÄ«va, all of which are experienced here ten times more severely.
There is also something superior to that:
In that hell of Fire Topknot, due to evil karma, there are many evil insects called topknot-like, in the hell realm, as long as a bowstring, with extremely severe poison and extremely sharp teeth.
The Yama hell wardens seize the hell beings, bind their hands and feet, spread their bodies on extremely hot iron hooks and on an extremely hot iron ground.
The hell denizens suffer like this, crying and wailing. First their backs are burned, and they experience extreme suffering.

The Yama demons take a worm resembling a topknot and place it in their anus. That worm resembling a topknot has a shape like a bowstring. Entering their bodies, it can create the most solid, poisonous, and urgent pain. Its touch is like fire, first burning the anus and then eating it.
Having eaten the anus, it next moves upward and enters their small intestine, burning it and eating it.
Having eaten the small intestine, it next moves upward and enters their large intestine, burning the large intestine and eating it.

Having eaten like this, it then enters the small intestine and large intestine in sequence, burning and biting and eating. In this way, it eats everything inside their bodies, running everywhere inside the bodies of the sinful people like a young dove, yet they still do not die.
In this way, the evil worm runs toward the esophagus. Running but not yet reaching, it burns and cooks their hearts, burning them and eating them all.
The hell denizens suffer like this, wailing and crying out. They are burned by these two fires: inside, the hair-like worms eat them, and outside, the great hellfire burns them.
The hair-like worms eat the esophagus, then move to the face. Having reached the face, they first burn the tongue.
Having burned the tongue, they bite and eat it.ğŸ”½Having eaten like this, they move to the ear and eat the ear.
Having eaten the ear, they move to the skull and eat the brain.
Having eaten it all, they break through the head and come out.

The hell denizens still do not die. By the power of their evil karma, there are holes all over the body. Such evil worms enter the holes again and are burned by the great hellfire. The whole body burns inside and out. Due to evil karmic actions.

In this way, for countless hundreds of thousands of years, they eat and eat again, and after eating, they are born again. After being born, they eat again. After dying, they revive. In this way, those sinners experience great suffering. This is the power of the accumulation of their evil karma.
After those hell beings escape from there, they run toward another place and see a great multitude of snakes coming all at once. Seeing this, they are extremely frightened and run to another place.
That multitude of snakes, created by evil karma, run as fast as the wind toward those sinners.

After arriving, they wrap around the entire body. Their fangs are extremely sharp and have great poisonous venom. They bite those sinners, causing them to experience hundreds of thousands of the most intense sufferings.
Those hell beings are thus burned by three fires:
first, the fire of hunger and thirst;
second, the fire of snake venom;
third, the fire of hell.

In this way, for innumerable hundreds of thousands of years, they are always burned like this, for an extremely long time without number, until their evil karma is exhausted, rotten, and its energy dissipated. At all times, they are given suffering without cease;
only when their evil karma is exhausted will they escape that hell.
Having escaped, for innumerable thousands of lifetimes they are born among hungry ghosts and animals. Among hungry ghosts, they are extremely burned by hunger and thirst;
they are born among all kinds of animals, and in every life they are killed by others, who then eat them.
If they escape that place, it is difficult to obtain a human body, like a turtle encountering a hole.
If they are born among humans in a place with similar karma, for five hundred lifetimes they become a third person, namely a eunuch.
This is the remaining karmic result of that evil karma.
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us know the fruits of karma and contemplate the place of the great burning and hot hell.
They see, hear, and know:
There is another place called Raining Sand Fire, which is the fourth separate place in that hell.
What karma do sentient beings have that causes them to be born in that place?
He saw:

There are people who kill, steal, engage in sexual misconduct, drink alcohol, lie, and hold wrong views, who enjoy doing these things and do them often. The karma and its results are as explained above.
There is also sexual misconduct:
Having committed evil acts with a novice nun, one's mind is filled with joy, and one still delights in it.

Due to the causes and conditions of this evil karma, when that person's body perishes and their life ends, they fall into a bad place, into that hell called Raining Sand Fire, and experience immense suffering.
The suffering is as explained above, the suffering experienced in the hells such as Saá¹ƒjÄ«va. All that suffering is experienced there.
There is also something worse, namely:

There, five hundred yojanas of great fire fills the place, all ablaze. There are adamantine sands that cover the entire area, soft like water. It can burn people, and they are still afraid of sinking, let alone those heavy with evil karma in hell.
When those hell beings enter, they sink as if sinking in water. Due to the cause of evil karma, they sink and then emerge again.
Those adamantine sands have triangular lumps with blades of extremely sharp fire, rubbing against the bodies of the sinners until the bones are exhausted. When exhausted, they grow again;
when grown, they are rubbed again, and when rubbed, they are exhausted again;
when exhausted, they grow again, dying and reviving, with no one to save them.
Falling into the burning sands, they cry out and wail, sighing and weeping. Due to evil karma, they cannot escape that painful place by themselves, for a long time;
if their evil karma is exhausted, they will then escape that hell.
Although they escape that place, for countless thousands of lifetimes they are born among hungry ghosts and animals.
If reborn as a hungry ghost, they are burned by hunger and thirst;
In the animal realm, they devour each other, and for a thousand lives, they are constantly killed by others.
If they escape that realm, it is difficult to attain a human body, like a turtle encountering a hole.
If reborn in the human realm in a place with the same karma, they are always poor, always sick, and not trusted by others, becoming a eunuch.
This is the remaining karmic retribution of their evil karma.
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us know the fruits of karma and contemplate the great burning hell, asking, 'What other places are there?'
They see, hear, and know:
There is another place called Inner Heat and Boiling, which is the fifth separate place in that hell.
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that place?
They see:
People who kill, steal, engage in sexual misconduct, drink alcohol, lie, and hold wrong views, who enjoy practicing and doing much of these actions, have karma and its fruits as explained above.
Moreover, some people have wrong views and engage in sexual misconduct:
He forcibly committed an offense with a laywoman who upheld the five precepts, defiling her pure conduct and causing her precepts to be broken.
He thought that breaking precepts was not a sin and did not believe in the fruits of karma.
Because of this evil intention and evil action, when that person's body collapsed and life ended, he fell into a bad place, into that hell's inner heat and boiling, and experienced great suffering.
The suffering is as previously explained, the suffering experienced in the hells such as Saá¹ƒjÄ«va, all that suffering is experienced there.
And there is more:

There are five fiery mountains there, all internally hot and boiling. Such five mountains pervade the entire hell, all boiling. The first is called Universal Burning, the second is called Extremely Deep and Bottomless, the third is called Dark Fire Mass Touch, the fourth is called Cutting and Slicing, and the fifth is called Karma Proof, pervading that hell for a thousand yojanas.

In this way, the five mountains are extremely far from Mount Potalaka and Mount MahÄpotalaka. The hell beings see the blue lotus flowers on those five mountains, with many forests and ponds on the mountains, and they hope to find comfort there. They quickly run towards them.
However, due to their evil karma, the fire inside the mountains is blown by evil winds, burning the bodies of the hell beings all over.
After being burned like this, they see another mountain, blue in color and large. Having been burned and suffered, they run towards it again, hoping for rescue and protection.
When they reach the mountain, they fall into it, just like an iron arrow shot by a crossbow into an ant hill. Having entered like this, they do not know where they are.
In this way, the hell beings sink into the hot boiling volcano inside, with nowhere to go.

The hell beings there are burned, boiled, and roasted in this way, and then enter again into the darkness, the mass of fire, the touch of evil mountains. All their faculties are blocked and they experience all kinds of suffering, like an arrow shot into a cushion. They experience all the fruits of evil karma.

In this way, the sinful people who have accumulated evil karma experience such fruits of suffering in the darkness, the mass of fire, the touch of evil mountains. The suffering is intense, without a master, without rescue, without companions. They eat the fruits of their own karma, suffering extreme pain for a long time, always burning, always boiling. Blown by the karma wind, their entire bodies are cooked in the boiling liquid.

Emerging from there, because they have no strength, they are unable to run. The Yama demons seize them again and place them on the mountain of dismemberment. With an iron saw that is ablaze, they cut their genitals. After cutting, they grow back. Fresh and tender, they are cut again. In this way, they are sawed countless hundreds of thousands of times, experiencing great suffering.
Again, he enters the mountain of karmic retribution and experiences great suffering, crying out in verse:
As I myself created karma, I now experience its fruits in this way.
Because the enemy of desire burns me, I have now arrived in this hell.
The unwholesomeness of the ground of heedlessness, the fire of desire burns the human body,
That snare binds me, and so I have come to this place.
I did not know before that the fruits of desire are so bitter,
Deceived by delusion, I created it myself and now experience it myself.
The merciless evil person brought me to this place,
In the boundless ocean of suffering, how can I escape?
Karma is suffering within suffering, I now experience it in this way,
Never seeing any happiness, the suffering of hell is not exhausted.
The hell-dweller experiences the first suffering in the ash-fire hell and cries out in this way.
The hell beings there experience great suffering at all times, until their evil karma is exhausted, rotten, and its energy is depleted. At all times, suffering is unceasing.
If their evil karma is exhausted, they will then escape that hell realm.
If they escape, they will be born in the realms of hungry ghosts and animals for countless hundreds of thousands of lifetimes.
Among hungry ghosts, they will see each other, their bodies burning with hunger and thirst.
Among animals, they will devour each other, dying and being reborn for hundreds of thousands of lifetimes.
Having escaped that place, it is difficult for them to obtain a human body, like a turtle encountering a hole.
If they are born among humans in a place with the same karma, due to the power of evil karma, they will be poor, sickly, and physically incomplete.
This is the remaining karmic result of their evil karma.
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us know the fruits of karma and contemplate: What other places are there in the great burning hell?
They see, hear, and know:
There is another place called 'Chatchacha', which is the sixth separate place in that hell.
What karma do sentient beings have that causes them to be born in that place?
He saw:

There are people who kill, steal, engage in sexual misconduct, drink alcohol, lie, and hold wrong views, who enjoy doing these things and do them often. The karma and its results are as explained above.
There is also sexual misconduct, which refers to:

Engaging in non-celibate activities with a woman who is under the protection of precepts, either once, twice, three times, four times, or five times. That person engages in such inappropriate activities, either with a sister, a relative, a woman with whom one has a spiritual connection, the wife of a spiritual friend, or a friend's wife, deceiving and engaging in sexual misconduct.

Due to the causes and conditions of that evil karma, when that person's body perishes and their life ends, they fall into a bad place, born in the separate place of 'Chatchacha' in that hell, experiencing great suffering.
The so-called suffering is as explained above, the suffering experienced in the hells such as Saá¹ƒjÄ«va, all of which are experienced here.
There is also a superior [suffering], namely:

There is an evil wind with the first force that touches, blows extremely hard, and causes the body of the sinful person in that hell to be divided and dissected, just like kapok, violently shaken like wool.
In this way, the extremely forceful and extremely evil great wind blows the sinful person's body, piece by piece, dispersed like fine wool, the wool also hardly visible.
What kind of wool?
Kapok wool.
When the wool is dispersed, it gathers again. The sinful person's body is also like this.
The evil wind blows it apart in the ten directions.

In that hell, the evil wind, like a knife, cuts and shatters the sinful person's body into pieces like sand, until there is not a single thing to be seen, in this way the body's parts, the wool also hardly visible.
Due to evil karma, all the body parts are reborn again, and after being reborn, they are scattered again, due to the power of desire.
Desire is as explained before.
In this way, for countless hundreds of thousands of years, until the evil karma is destroyed, rotten, and the karmic energy is exhausted, suffering is given at all times without cease.
If one escapes this suffering, there are also vajra rats in that place, which eat the person's genitals, breaking them into pieces like mustard seeds. One suffers and cries out.
After eating the person's genitals, they next eat the intestines;ğŸ”½after eating the intestines, they next eat the cooked intestines;
after eating the cooked intestines, they emerge from the back and next eat the back;
after eating the back, they next eat the backbones.

Due to the evil karma of that evil karmic person, in this way for countless hundreds of thousands of years, he receives the suffering of hell, and for a long time, escapes the suffering he receives there.

Having escaped, they run off in another direction, but there are black worms that wrap around their bodies, first binding the genitals and then burning and eating them. They experience extreme suffering and cry out loudly.

In this way, the black worms constantly wrap around and eat them, until the evil karma they created and accumulated has disintegrated and rotted away, and the energy of the karma is exhausted. At all times, they are given no respite from suffering.
